newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia wants OPEC to maintain output ceiling.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia wants OPEC to maintain output ceiling.

text.p: Mines and Energy Minister Ida Bagus Sudjana said on Tuesday Indonesia wanted OPEC to maintain its output ceiling of 25.033 million barrels per day (bpd) for another year when the group meets in Vienna in November.
"Yes we want the output ceiling to be maintained, hopefully for another year but let's see the developments. Oil prices are currently at a good level," Sudjana told reporters.
"I think if we keep the ceiling, prices will be stable. If we raise the ceiling, I am afraid it will encourage other (non-OPEC) producers to boost output too," he said.
OPEC ministers will gather in Vienna late next month to discuss developments in the oil market.
A Reuter survey of OPEC production in September found output running at 25.86 million bpd, compared to the 25.033 million ceiling.
A torrid rally which has taken oil prices higher by as much as $9 a barrel over last year's level paused for breath on Monday but bullish sentiment remains, traders said.
London December futures for international benchmark Brent crude closed up 12 cents on Monday at $24.65, recovering from the day's low of $24.38.
